posts.post_content:
This card is such a good sacrifice outlet, and can eat up Orzhovs many spirit tokens and Doomed Travelers to get in there for unblockable damage. May just be the card Exalted was looking for in standard. An the art is just fantastic!  
  
Although people should be wary of putting Auras on her. If she has to give herself protection of a color that matches the color of an aura on her, the aura will fall off. Shame, would really love to put [Gift of Orzhova](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Gift of Orzhova) on her.
posts.html:

Although people should be wary of putting Auras on her. If she has to give herself protection of a color that matches the color of an aura on her, the aura will fall off. Shame, would really love to put Gift of Orzhova on her.

Posted By: lorendorky (1/22/2013 3:08:22 PM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
Hmm...when I first saw this card, I wasn't that impressed with it. I immediately thought of [Bloodthrone Vampire](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Bloodthrone Vampire) and asked myself why would I choose this over the latter?  
I think that the main difference is that this is much harder to get rid of. It's not that great, but you can still build around it and give it some auras (that are normally unreliable, but with this, they can be in a pretty safe position).  
....Or be cheap and go with hexproof creatures :D

posts.post_content:
A sacrifice outlet that can protect itself by making use of it. Interesting.  
When used, it can also find use as a solid blocker, or even an occational [Phantom Warrior](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Phantom Warrior).  
  
And that flavor text oozed of Orzhov-natured arrogance.  
  
Another thing regarding the artwork:  
Her awesomely intrusive, yet still elegant and simple outfit seems like an awesome choice for cosplay :D

posts.post_content:
Actually, I wouldn't be a bit surprised if, after the destruction of the entire Simic Combine last block, the Orzhov have not yet gotten around to reopening the Guild's old accounts. Speaker Zegana may have to spend all the cards she draws just to get through the paperwork of accessing the old Guild funds....if she's even legally entitled to them. Why do you assume that would be the case, when the Ravnican Legal Code has not had any need in millenia to provide any clauses defining Merfolk as people? They are quite legally Mythological.  
  
Oh, ORZHOV, you ARE the Devious Legalistic bunch of CROOKS! XD   
THAT'S how you take down your opponents. :P  
  
Freeze their accounts and show that, legally, their population is mostly made up of non-person non-citizens. :P
